item.title: Temporary lights phasing wrong - causing mayhem, 1st January
item.description:
There are gas or electric works at the junction of dunton and lynton Road where the lights are phased so badly people are going through red lights and it’s causing major safety concerns for pedestrians and motorists not to mention the constant horns being used which is terrible for the local resident. Please sort it out asap!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunton Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning required, 1st January
item.description:
Message to RBoG: Do not mark as fixed when it is not. Road needs some TLC - there are newspapers from October and November rotting in the gutter. Leaves everywhere and rubbish strewn across the street

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rectory Place, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rectory Place, 1st January
item.description:
Rectory Place - Requires TLC & Street Cleanse Re Sent to Royal Borough of Greenwich less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 8613607. Photo of this report Photo of this report Originally raised under FixMyStreet ref: 8613422 and subsequently under ref: 8613607 however RBoG have stated this is ‘fixed’ which it is not! Do not fix the ticket without any action - I will using this as evidence to show to the council and the MP Please do not close without actioning. —————————————————————— Requires a litter pick / street clean please as well as collection of rotting leaves. Lots of litter incl. rotting newspapers, crisps packets, plastic bags and other paraphernalia. Could you please dedicate a litter pick session to this area as this is an eye sore and people see this all day every day. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rectory Place, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Growing rubbish pile, 1st January
item.description:
The rubbish around the recycling bin is being added to daily. This is a huge issue as not all the rubbish is now recyclable! Residents need educating as to what the blue bin is for with leaflet drop and or clear signage.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charles Grinling Walk, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 1st January

item.title: Many black bags of rubbish dumped, 1st January
item.description:
A few black bags were left outside 36 Dinsdale Road, which is currently unoccupied. It seems people are now adding to this with more black bags each day! All left on pavement outside the house. Where new water pipes were being laid and road dug up the bin men have ignored them it would seem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dinsdale Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rectory Place - Requires TLC & Street Cleanse, 1st January
item.description:
Originally raised under FixMyStreet ref: 8613422 however RBoG have closed the ticket without any action. Please do not close without actioning. —————————————————————— Requires a litter pick / street clean please as well as collection of rotting leaves. Lots of litter incl. rotting newspapers, crisps packets, plastic bags and other paraphernalia. Could you please dedicate a litter pick session to this area as this is an eye sore and people see this all day every day. Thank you.
